abstract: As Comcast lobbies regulators to approve its NBC takeover, it has a case study in awkward entanglements as an employee cries foul over his firing after criticizing a Fox News host.
snippet: As Comcast lobbies regulators to approve its NBC takeover, it has a case study in awkward entanglements as an employee cries foul over his firing after criticizing a Fox News host.
lead_paragraph: Criticizing Fox News is a year-round sport for many hosts on MSNBC, the cable news channel, and especially for Keith Olbermann, whose verbal spitballs at the Fox host Bill O’Reilly have occasionally put his parent company, NBC Universal, on edge, Brian Stelter reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: If Comcast Buys NBC, Will Fox Lose an Adversary?
